CommitStore and EVM2EVMOffRamp form an xchain upgradeable unit. Any change to one of them results an onchain upgrade of all 3.OCR2BaseNoChecks is used to save gas, signatures are not required as the offramp can only execute messages which are committed in the commitStore. We still make use of OCR2 as an executor whitelist and turn-taking mechanism","events":{"ConfigSet((address,uint64,uint64,address,address,address,address),(uint32,uint32,uint16,address,address,uint32,uint32))":{"details":"Atlas depends on this event, if changing, please notify Atlas."},"ConfigSet(uint32,bytes32,uint64,address[],address[],uint8,bytes,uint64,bytes)":{"params":{"configCount":"ordinal number of this config setting among all config settings over the life of this contract","configDigest":"configDigest of this configuration","f":"maximum number of faulty/dishonest oracles the protocol can tolerate while still working correctly","offchainConfig":"serialized configuration used by the oracles exclusively and only passed through the contract","offchainConfigVersion":"version of the serialization format used for \"offchainConfig\" parameter","onchainConfig":"serialized configuration used by the contract (and possibly oracles)","previousConfigBlockNumber":"block in which the previous config was set, to simplify historic analysis","signers":"ith element is address ith oracle uses to sign a report","transmitters":"ith element is address ith oracle uses to transmit a report via the transmit method"}},"ExecutionStateChanged(uint64,bytes32,uint8,bytes)":{"details":"RMN depends on this event, if changing, please notify the RMN by the contract itself, in order to try/catch its execution and enforce atomicity among successful message processing and token transfer.We use ERC-165 to check for the ccipReceive interface to permit sending tokens to contracts (for example smart contract wallets) without an associated message.","params":{"message":"The message that will be executed.","offchainTokenData":"Token transfer data to be passed to TokenPool."}},"getAllRateLimitTokens()":{"details":"the order of IDs in the list is **not guaranteed**, therefore, if ordering matters when making successive calls, one should keep the block height constant to ensure a consistent result.","returns":{"destTokens":"The destination representation of the tokens that are rate limited.","sourceTokens":"The source representation of the tokens that are rate limited."}},"getDynamicConfig()":{"returns":{"_0":"The current config."}},"getExecutionState(uint64)":{"details":"we use the literal number 128 because using a constant increased gas usage.","params":{"sequenceNumber":"The sequence number of the message to get the execution state for."},"returns":{"_0":"The current execution state of the message."}},"getSenderNonce(address)":{"params":{"sender":"The sender address"},"returns":{"nonce":"The nonce value belonging to the sender address."}},"getStaticConfig()":{"details":"This function will always return the same struct as the contents is static and can never change. RMN depends on this function, if changing, please notify the RMN maintainers."},"getTokenLimitAdmin()":{"returns":{"_0":"the token limit admin address."}},"getTransmitters()":{"details":"The list will match the order used to specify the transmitter during setConfig","returns":{"_0":"list of addresses permitted to transmit reports to this contract"}},"latestConfigDetails()":{"returns":{"blockNumber":"block at which this config was set","configCount":"ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far","configDigest":"domain-separation tag for current config (see _configDigestFromConfigData)"}},"latestConfigDigestAndEpoch()":{"returns":{"configDigest":"configDigest","epoch":"epoch","scanLogs":"indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead."}},"manuallyExecute(((uint64,address,address,uint64,uint256,bool,uint64,address,uint256,bytes,(address,uint256)[],bytes[],bytes32)[],bytes[][],bytes32[],uint256),uint256[])":{"details":"We permit gas limit overrides so that users may manually execute messages which failed due to insufficient gas provided.","params":{"gasLimitOverrides":"New gasLimit for each message in the report.","report":"Internal.ExecutionReport."}},"setAdmin(address)":{"details":"setting this to address(0) indicates there is no active admin.","params":{"newAdmin":"the address of the new admin."}},"setOCR2Config(address[],address[],uint8,bytes,uint64,bytes)":{"params":{"f":"number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate","offchainConfig":"encoded off-chain oracle configuration","offchainConfigVersion":"version number for offchainEncoding schema","onchainConfig":"encoded on-chain contract configuration","signers":"addresses with which oracles sign the reports","transmitters":"addresses oracles use to transmit the reports"}},"setRateLimiterConfig((bool,uint128,uint128))":{"details":"should only be callable by the owner or token limit admin.","params":{"config":"The new rate limiter config."}},"transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],bytes32[],bytes32)":{"params":{"report":"serialized report, which the signatures are signing.","rs":"ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most MAX_NUM_ORACLES entries","ss":"ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most MAX_NUM_ORACLES entries"}},"updateRateLimitTokens((address,address)[],(address,address)[])":{"params":{"adds":"- A list of one or more tokens to be added.","removes":"- A list of one or more tokens to be removed."}}},"stateVariables":{"i_chainSelector":{"details":"ChainSelector of this chain"},"i_commitStore":{"details":"Commit store address on the destination chain"},"i_metadataHash":{"details":"metadataHash is a lane-specific prefix for a message hash preimage which ensures global uniqueness. Ensures that 2 identical messages sent to 2 different lanes will have a distinct hash. Must match the metadataHash used in computing leaf hashes offchain for the root committed in the commitStore and i_metadataHash in the onRamp."},"i_onRamp":{"details":"OnRamp address on the source chain"},"i_prevOffRamp":{"details":"The address of previous-version OffRamp for this lane. Used to be able to provide sequencing continuity during a zero downtime upgrade."},"i_rmnProxy":{"details":"The address of the RMN proxy"},"i_sourceChainSelector":{"details":"ChainSelector of the source chain"},"i_tokenAdminRegistry":{"details":"The address of the token admin registry"},"s_executionStates":{"details":"A mapping of sequence numbers to execution state using a bitmap with each execution state only taking up 2 bits of the uint256, packing 128 states into a single slot. Message state is tracked to ensure message can only be executed successfully once."},"s_rateLimitedTokensDestToSource":{"details":"Tokens that should be included in Aggregate Rate Limiting An (address => address) map is used for backwards compatability of offchain code"},"s_senderNonce":{"details":"The expected nonce for a given sender. Corresponds to s_senderNonce in the OnRamp, used to enforce that messages are executed in the same order they are sent (assuming they are not out-of-order messages). Note that re-execution of FAILED messages however, can be out of order."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"ConfigSet(uint32,bytes32,uint64,address[],address[],uint8,bytes,uint64,bytes)":{"notice":"triggers a new run of the offchain reporting protocol"},"Transmitted(bytes32,uint32)":{"notice":"optionally emitted to indicate the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may use latestConfigDigestAndEpoch with scanLogs set to false."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"acceptOwnership()":{"notice":"Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient."},"ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,(address,uint256)[]))":{"notice":"Reverts as this contract should not access CCIP messages"},"currentRateLimiterState()":{"notice":"Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at."},"executeSingleMessage((uint64,address,address,uint64,uint256,bool,uint64,address,uint256,bytes,(address,uint256)[],bytes[],bytes32),bytes[])":{"notice":"Execute a single message."},"getAllRateLimitTokens()":{"notice":"Get all tokens which are included in Aggregate Rate Limiting."},"getDynamicConfig()":{"notice":"Returns the current dynamic config."},"getExecutionState(uint64)":{"notice":"Returns the current execution state of a message based on its sequenceNumber."},"getSenderNonce(address)":{"notice":"Returns the the current nonce for a receiver."},"getStaticConfig()":{"notice":"Returns the static config."},"getTokenLimitAdmin()":{"notice":"Gets the token limit admin address."},"latestConfigDetails()":{"notice":"information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration"},"latestConfigDigestAndEpoch()":{"notice":"optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may return scanLogs set to true and use Transmitted events to provide this information to offchain watchers."},"manuallyExecute(((uint64,address,address,uint64,uint256,bool,uint64,address,uint256,bytes,(address,uint256)[],bytes[],bytes32)[],bytes[][],bytes32[],uint256),uint256[])":{"notice":"Manually address."},"setOCR2Config(address[],address[],uint8,bytes,uint64,bytes)":{"notice":"sets offchain reporting protocol configuration incl. participating contract"},"updateRateLimitTokens((address,address)[],(address,address)[])":{"notice":"Adds or removes tokens from being used in Aggregate Rate Limiting."}},"notice":"EVM2EVMOffRamp enables OCR executeSingleMessage((uint64,address,add.details: We make this external and callable by the contract itself, in order to try/catch its execution and enforce atomicity among successful message processing and token transfer.We use ERC-165 to check for the ccipReceive interface to permit sending tokens to contracts (for example smart contract wallets) without an associated message.

params.message: The message that will be executed.
params.offchainTokenData: Token transfer data to be passed to TokenPool.

getAllRateLimitTokens().details: the order of IDs in the list is **not guaranteed**, therefore, if ordering matters when making successive calls, one should keep the block height constant to ensure a consistent result.

returns.destTokens: The destination representation of the tokens that are rate limited.
returns.sourceTokens: The source representation of the tokens that are rate limited.

getExecutionState(uint64).details: we use the literal number 128 because using a constant increased gas usage.

params.sequenceNumber: The sequence number of the message to get the execution state for.

returns._0: The current execution state of the message.

returns.nonce: The nonce value belonging to the sender address.

getStaticConfig().details: This function will always return the same struct as the contents is static and can never change. RMN depends on this function, if changing, please notify the RMN maintainers.

getTransmitters().details: The list will match the order used to specify the transmitter during setConfig

returns._0: list of addresses permitted to transmit reports to this contract

returns.blockNumber: block at which this config was set
returns.configCount: ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far

returns.scanLogs: indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead.

manuallyExecute(((uint64,address,address.details: We permit gas limit overrides so that users may manually execute messages which failed due to insufficient gas provided.

params.gasLimitOverrides: New gasLimit for each message in the report.

setAdmin(address).details: setting this to address(0) indicates there is no active admin.

params.newAdmin: the address of the new admin.

params.f: number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate
params.signers: addresses with which oracles sign the reports
params.transmitters: addresses oracles use to transmit the reports

setRateLimiterConfig((bool,uint128,uint1.details: should only be callable by the owner or token limit admin.

params.report: serialized report, which the signatures are signing.
params.rs: ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most MAX_NUM_ORACLES entries
params.ss: ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most MAX_NUM_ORACLES entries

params.adds: - A list of one or more tokens to be added.
params.removes: - A list of one or more tokens to be removed.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.notice: Reverts as this contract should not access CCIP messages

currentRateLimiterState().notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getAllRateLimitTokens().notice: Get all tokens which are included in Aggregate Rate Limiting.

getExecutionState(uint64).notice: Returns the current execution state of a message based on its sequenceNumber.

getSenderNonce(address).notice: Returns the the current nonce for a receiver.

getTokenLimitAdmin().notice: Gets the token limit admin address.

latestConfigDetails().notice: information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration

latestConfigDigestAndEpoch().notice: optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may return scanLogs set to true and use Transmitted events to provide this information to offchain watchers.

setAdmin(address).notice: Sets the token limit admin address.

setOCR2Config(address[],address[],uint8,.notice: sets offchain reporting protocol configuration incl. participating oracles

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],byte.notice: transmit is called to post a new report to the contract

updateRateLimitTokens((address,address)[.notice: Adds or removes tokens from being used in Aggregate Rate Limiting.

documentation.text: @dev Atlas depends on this event, if changing, please notify Atlas.
@dev RMN depends on this event, if changing, please notify the RMN maintainers.

@notice Static offRamp config
 @dev RMN depends on this struct, if changing, please notify the RMN maintainers.

@notice Dynamic offRamp config
 @dev since OffRampConfig is part of OffRampConfigChanged event, if changing it, we should update the ABI on Atlas
@notice RateLimitToken struct containing both the source and destination token addresses
@dev Commit store address on the destination chain
@dev ChainSelector of the source chain
@dev ChainSelector of this chain
@dev OnRamp address on the source chain

@dev metadataHash is a lane-specific prefix for a message hash preimage which ensures global uniqueness.
 Ensures that 2 identical messages sent to 2 different lanes will have a distinct hash.
 Must match the metadataHash used in computing leaf hashes offchain for the root committed in
 the commitStore and i_metadataHash in the onRamp.

@dev The address of previous-version OffRamp for this lane.
 Used to be able to provide sequencing continuity during a zero downtime upgrade.
@dev The address of the RMN proxy
@dev The address of the token admin registry

@dev Tokens that should be included in Aggregate Rate Limiting
 An (address => address) map is used for backwards compatability of offchain code
@inheritdoc IAny2EVMOffRamp

@notice Entrypoint for execution, called by the OCR network
 @dev Expects an encoded ExecutionReport

function (struct Internal.EVM2EVMMessage memory,bytes memory[] memory) external
function (uint256) pure returns (struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory[] memory)
function (struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory[] memory,bytes memory,address,bytes memory[] memory,bytes memory[] memory) returns (struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory[] memory)
function (struct Internal.EVM2EVMMessage memory,struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory[] memory) pure returns (struct Client.Any2EVMMessage memory)
function (struct Client.Any2EVMMessage memory,uint16,uint256,address) external returns (bool,bytes memory,uint256)

documentation.text: @notice creates a unique hash to be used in message hashing.

@notice Returns the current dynamic config.
 @return The current config.
@notice Sets the dynamic config. This function is called during `setOCR2Config` flow

function (uint256,bytes memory,address,struct Internal.SourceTokenData memory,bytes memory) returns (struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory)
function (struct Client.EVMTokenAmount memory,contract IPriceRegistry) view returns (uint256)

documentation.text: @notice Reverts as this contract should not access CCIP messages
